summary: The bill, titled the Foundation for Enabling Biotechnology Innovation Act, establishes a non-profit foundation to accelerate the commercialization of biotechnology products in the United States. The Foundation will support public-private partnerships, convene stakeholders, advance collaboration between federal agencies, conduct public engagement, facilitate market access, support research, and develop education programs. It will be governed by a board of directors and will operate independently of the federal government, focusing on promoting innovation and commercialization without regulating biotechnology products. The bill authorizes appropriations to support the Foundation's activities, including transfer of funds from the National Science Foundation.
